name: Acrobatics
summary: Checks made to keep your balance, tumble, and slip past foes.
description: Your Dexterity (Acrobatics) check covers difficult attempts to stay on your feet, tumble, or reduce the impact of a fall. The DM might ask for an Acrobatics check when you try to cross a precarious surface, perform acrobatic stunts, or escape a grapple by twisting free.

name: Animal Handling
summary: Use Wisdom to calm or control beasts and mounts.
description: When you try to calm a domesticated animal, keep a mount from bolting, or intuit a beast's intentions, the DM might call for a Wisdom (Animal Handling) check. You can also use the skill to improve the attitude of wild animals with food, gentle words, or training.
examples: Teach a dog a simple trick

name: Arcana
summary: Recall lore about spells, magic items, and planar mysteries.
description: An Intelligence (Arcana) check measures your ability to recall magical theory. You might identify a spell as it is being cast, remember facts about magical traditions, or notice the presence of planar portals and other supernatural phenomena.
examples: Know how a spell scroll functions

name: Athletics
summary: Feats of physical power like climbing, jumping, and wrestling.
description: Your Strength (Athletics) check covers attempts to climb, jump, swim, or grapple. You might use it to shove a foe, break free of restraints, or leap across a chasm.
examples: Pin a creature to the ground

name: Deception
summary: Convince others of lies or hide the truth with words and actions.
description: A Charisma (Deception) check determines whether you can convincingly hide the truth. You can fast-talk a guard, forge a believable disguise, or conceal your motives under a pleasant smile.

name: History
summary: Recall important events, legendary heroes, and past cultures.
description: An Intelligence (History) check lets you recall historical facts, royal lineages, ancient wars, and lost civilizations. The DM might also use it to determine whether you recognize heraldry or legal precedent.

name: Insight
summary: Discern motives, read body language, and spot lies.
description: A Wisdom (Insight) check decides whether you can read a creature's true intentions. You might use it to see through a disguise, sense if someone is lying, or understand a situation's emotional tone.

name: Intimidation
summary: Use threats or forceful presence to influence others.
description: When you try to cow someone with menacing words or gestures, the DM can call for a Charisma (Intimidation) check. You can frighten a prisoner, make a bold demand, or force a creature to back down.

name: Investigation
summary: Search for clues, deduce hidden mechanisms, and solve puzzles.
description: When you look for clues and make deductions, you use an Intelligence (Investigation) check. You might pour over books for a hidden cypher, analyze a crime scene, or determine how a trap functions.
examples: Figure out how to disable a trap

name: Medicine
summary: Stabilize the dying and diagnose ailments.
description: A Wisdom (Medicine) check lets you diagnose illnesses, find a creature's vital signs, or apply first aid to stabilize a dying companion.

name: Nature
summary: Identify plants, animals, weather, and the natural order.
description: An Intelligence (Nature) check lets you recall lore about terrain, plants, animals, the weather, and natural cycles. The skill can also cover knowledge of elemental forces tied to the natural world.

name: Perception
summary: Notice hidden creatures, faint sounds, and other details.
description: A Wisdom (Perception) check lets you spot, hear, or otherwise detect the presence of something. It measures your awareness of the surroundings and keenness of your senses.
examples: Notice a faint smell of smoke

name: Performance
summary: Captivate an audience with acting, music, or storytelling.
description: A Charisma (Performance) check determines how well you delight an audience with music, dance, acting, or other forms of entertainment.

name: Persuasion
summary: Influence others with courtesy, tact, and honest appeal.
description: A Charisma (Persuasion) check measures your ability to negotiate, inspire, or otherwise influence others without deception. Use it to secure aid, change opinions, or broker deals.

name: Religion
summary: Recall lore about deities, rites, and planar hierarchies.
description: An Intelligence (Religion) check allows you to recall knowledge about gods, religious traditions, sacred symbols, and planar beings tied to the divine.
examples: Know the tenets of a faith

name: Sleight of Hand
summary: Palm objects, pick pockets, and perform subtle tricks.
description: Whenever you attempt to conceal an object on your person, plant something on someone else, or lift a purse, the DM can ask for a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check.

name: Stealth
summary: Sneak silently and stay out of sight.
description: A Dexterity (Stealth) check lets you conceal yourself from enemies, move silently, or hide objects. The DM might call for it when you blend into a crowd or creep through a dark hallway.

name: Survival
summary: Track creatures, find shelter, and endure the wilds.
description: A Wisdom (Survival) check allows you to follow tracks, hunt wild game, guide a party through harsh terrain, or predict the weather.
